study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a low-fat mayonnaise using yolk-casein through post-acidification to mimic the texture of high-fat mayonnaise while reducing oil content.
results_summary: Post-acid-treated low-fat mayonnaise showed a 77.80% improvement in G' and 90.18% increase in viscosity compared to pre-acid-treated versions, achieving semisolid properties via a dense yolk-casein self-assembly network.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or food product study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (30% oil content in the final product).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how different dairy sterilization techniques affect the structural and functional characteristics of EGCG-casein (EGCG-CS) complexes.
results_summary: The study found that thermal treatments above 85°C disrupted non-covalent bonds in EGCG-CS, leading to instability and reduced viscosity. However, a 15-second treatment at 85°C improved structural stability, foaming, and emulsifying abilities of the complexes.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)
study_duration: Not specified (single treatment durations varied from 5 seconds to 30 minutes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the fasting hypoglycemic effect of casein hydrolysate (CH) in diabetic-like mice and identify the underlying mechanisms through multiomics analysis.
results_summary: CH administration reduced fasting blood glucose by 14.73%, alleviated insulin resistance by 36.91%, and improved hepatic glucose metabolism by upregulating key genes (pparg, pik3cb) and enhancing the PPAR and insulin/PI3K/AKT signaling pathways. Glx-containing peptides in CH were identified as potential active components for its hypoglycemic effect.
population_specificity: db/db diabetic-like mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the inhibitory potential of newly synthesized dibenzofuran-based compounds against the protein kinase CK2 for potential cancer treatment.
results_summary: Two compounds (12b and 12c) showed strong CK2 inhibition with IC50 values of 5.8 nM, effectively crossed cell membranes, and reduced intracellular CK2 activity in LNCaP prostate carcinoma cells. Co-crystallization revealed structural interactions between 12c and CK2α, providing insights into structure-activity relationships.
population_specificity: LNCaP human prostate carcinoma cells (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (IC50 values provided for compounds 12b and 12c: 5.8 nM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether cold argon plasma (CAP) treatment could reduce the antigenicity of Casein by altering its epitope structure and sequence.
results_summary: A 12-minute CAP treatment reduced Casein antigenicity by 80.46%, with observed aggregation and fragmentation of Casein. Disruption of linear epitopes in the α-helix region and modifications to amino acids with aromatic side chains contributed to reduced allergenicity.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of CX-4945, a selective CK2 inhibitor, on glioblastoma (GBM) cell proliferation and blood-brain barrier (BBB) homeostasis.
results_summary: CX-4945 reduced proliferative activity in GBM cells and modulated pathways involved in tumor progression, including apoptosis. It also restored tight junctions' expression in the BBB model, showing promising antiproliferative effects in both in vitro and xenograft studies.
population_specificity: Human U-87 glioblastoma cell line and hCMEC/D3 cell line (BBB model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of dielectric barrier discharge cold plasma (DBD-CP) technology on the quality, texture, antibacterial activity, and structure of casein acid-gel.
results_summary: DBD-CP treatment significantly improved water holding capacity (WHC) and electrical conductivity of the gel, altered protein structure (reduced α-helix, increased β-angle), and enhanced gel quality, with indirect processing (IP) yielding better results than direct processing (DP). The optimal conditions were 50 V for 60 s.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on casein acid-gel)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the combined effects of highland barley polysaccharides (HBP) and low-frequency static magnetic field (LF-SMF) treatment on the structure and properties of acid-induced casein (CS) coacervates.
results_summary: The study found that adding HBP and LF-SMF treatment enhanced casein aggregation, crosslinking, and coacervate properties, leading to improved viscoelasticity, microstructure, and encapsulation efficiency for probiotics. M-CS/HBP coacervates showed superior protection for probiotics under adverse conditions.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how enzymatic hydrolysis with flavourzyme affects the structural properties of yak casein and its inhibitory effects on xanthine oxidase (XOD).
results_summary: The study found that flavourzyme treatment fragmented yak casein into smaller particles, altered its secondary and tertiary structures, and produced hydrolysates with XOD inhibitory activity, peaking at 40.63% inhibition after 3 hours of hydrolysis. The fraction with a molecular weight exceeding 3 kDa showed enhanced XOD inhibitory activity.
population_specificity: Yak casein (in vitro study, no human or animal subjects)
study_duration: Hydrolysis durations varied up to 4 hours

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of amorphous calcium phosphate-casein phosphopeptide (ACP-CPP) agent with two diode lasers (660 nm and 980 nm) in treating dentinal hypersensitivity.
results_summary: The ACP-CPP agent was less effective than both diode lasers in reducing dentinal hypersensitivity throughout the trial period, though all three treatments showed positive results as desensitizers. No statistically significant difference was observed between the two lasers at 1, 3, and 6 months.
population_specificity: 39 patients with at least three hypersensitive teeth in one quadrant.
study_duration: 6 months (with evaluations at baseline, 30 min, 1 week, 1 month, 3 months, and 6 months)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how mixing casein micelles (CMs) with pea proteins affects gel formation and final structure, exploring protein ratios and thermal treatment effects.
results_summary: Replacing CMs with pea proteins delayed gel formation but increased final gel elasticity at certain ratios (80:20 and 60:40), suggesting pea proteins form a network when surrounded by CMs. The study found that protein ratios and thermal treatment can tailor mixed gel characteristics.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether recombinant NAP expressed on B. subtilis spores could effectively treat casein allergy in mice by modulating immune responses.
results_summary: NAP recombinant spore treatment reduced allergic symptoms and inflammation, increased Th1 cytokines (IL-12, IFN-γ), decreased casein-specific IgE and IgG1, and elevated TLR2 and c-JUN expression in jejunal tissue. In vitro, NAP spores polarized macrophages to the M1 phenotype, enhancing cytokine expression via TLR2.
population_specificity: Mice sensitized to bovine casein.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how leptin influences milk production in mammary epithelial cells (MECs), specifically its effect on β-casein production and STAT5 inactivation.
results_summary: Leptin inhibited β-casein production in MECs in a concentration-dependent manner and inactivated STAT5, a key transcription factor for milk production. Apical leptin exposure (mimicking milk leptin) had inhibitory effects, while basolateral exposure (mimicking plasma leptin) did not.
population_specificity: Mouse mammary epithelial cells (MECs) in a culture model.
effective_dosage: Concentration-dependent leptin treatment (specific amounts not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of Alpha-s1 casein hydrolysate (ACH) on sleep quality in individuals with chronic insomnia using both subjective and objective measures.
results_summary: ACH supplementation significantly improved sleep quality, reducing GSDS scores and sleep onset latency, with notable improvements in ISI, GSDS, PSQI, ESS, and HADS scores compared to placebo. PSG data confirmed these benefits, showing a significant decrease in sleep onset latency.
population_specificity: Taiwanese individuals with chronic insomnia in a hospital-based cohort.
effective_dosage: 600 mg daily for the first two weeks, then 300 mg daily for the remaining two weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the physiological effects of casein glycomacropeptide (GMP) versus phenylalanine-free amino acids (AA) in children with PKU, focusing on gut health, oxidative stress, renal function, inflammation, and satiety.
results_summary: GMP significantly improved GI symptoms (stomach pain, heartburn, bloating) compared to AA, with trends for less constipation and nausea. However, no significant differences were found in gut health markers, oxidative stress, or inflammation, except for minor changes in adiponectin and antioxidant capacity. Blood phenylalanine levels were higher with GMP.
population_specificity: Children (4-9 years old, 8 males) with classical PKU.
study_duration: 12 weeks per intervention arm, with a 4-week washout period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of casein kinase 2 (CK2) in dysregulation of SK channels in dopamine neurons and its potential contribution to behavioral abnormalities in Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The study found that casein kinase 2 (CK2) was upregulated in dopamine neurons of 3xTg-AD mice, contributing to SK channel dysfunction and neuronal hyperexcitability. Pharmacological inhibition of CK2 restored normal SK channel activity and firing patterns, suggesting a potential therapeutic target for Alzheimer's-related behavioral deficits.
population_specificity: 3xTg-AD mouse model (amyloid + tau-driven Alzheimer's disease model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether nucleolar CK2α staining could serve as a prognostic marker for recurrence and survival in early-stage lung adenocarcinoma patients.
results_summary: Positive nucleolar CK2α staining was found in 50.8% of tumors and was associated with significantly worse recurrence-free survival. Multivariate analysis identified nucleolar CK2α staining and lymph node metastasis as independent poor prognostic factors.
population_specificity: 118 patients who underwent pulmonary lobectomy for early-stage lung adenocarcinoma between 2014 and 2018 at Fukushima Medical University Hospital.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-neoplastic effects of CIGB-300, a CK2 inhibitor, in lung cancer cells lacking EGFR, ALK, and ROS mutations.
results_summary: CIGB-300 impaired viability and proliferation of lung cancer cells, induced ROS and mitochondrial membrane depolarization, and demonstrated anti-tumor effects in xenograft models by reducing CK2 subunit phosphorylation.
population_specificity: Lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and lung squamous carcinoma (LUSC) cell lines (A549, NCI-H522, NCI-H226, SK-MES-1) and xenograft models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and recommended phase 2 dose of BTX-A51, a small molecule inhibitor targeting casein kinase 1α (CK1α), in patients with relapsed or refractory AML and MDS.
results_summary: BTX-A51 increased p53 expression and reduced MCL1 expression, with 10% of patients achieving complete remission with incomplete count recovery (CRi). Efficacy was higher (30%) in RUNX1-mutated patients at doses of 11mg or higher, and ex-vivo studies showed synergy with azacitidine and venetoclax.
population_specificity: Patients with relapsed or refractory acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS).
effective_dosage: 1mg to 42mg dosed three days/week for 21 or 28 days out of a 28-day cycle (recommended phase 2 dose: 21mg three days/week for 4 weeks).
study_duration: 28-day cycles (21 or 28 days of dosing per cycle).
interactions: Synergy noted with azacitidine and venetoclax in ex-vivo studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether casein-dextran (CD) conjugates could stabilize Pickering emulsions to enhance lutein delivery and mitigate blue light-induced retinal degeneration.
results_summary: The study found that CD-stabilized Pickering emulsions improved lutein retention and bioaccessibility, with the CD-75% formulation showing the best performance. In vivo experiments demonstrated that lutein-loaded Pickering emulsions effectively alleviated blue light-induced retinal degeneration in mice.
population_specificity: Mice (in vivo experiments)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of high-pressure processing (HPP) on the physicochemical and structural properties of micellar casein concentrates (MCC) from bovine and caprine milk.
results_summary: HPP increased mineral solubility and reduced particle size more significantly in bovine MCC compared to caprine MCC. Structural changes, such as shifts in α-helix and β-sheet content, were also observed, suggesting HPP can enhance functional characteristics of casein.
population_specificity: Reconstituted micellar casein concentrates from bovine and caprine milk.
effective_dosage: Pressures ranging from 100 to 500 MPa for 30 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a toothpaste containing casein phosphopeptide amorphous calcium phosphate (CPP-ACP) combined with fluoride and sodium trimetaphosphate (TMP) in preventing dental demineralization and altering biofilm composition.
results_summary: The study found that toothpaste with 1100F-CPP-ACP-TMP significantly reduced enamel hardness loss by 42% compared to fluoride alone and increased fluoride, calcium, and phosphorus concentrations in enamel and biofilm while reducing insoluble extracellular polysaccharide (EPS) levels.
population_specificity: 10 volunteers wearing intraoral appliances with bovine enamel specimens.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of MI varnish (containing casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate), diode laser irradiation, and their combination on remineralization of white spot lesions (WSLs) in enamel.
results_summary: All treatment groups (MI varnish, diode laser, and their combination) showed significantly higher microhardness values compared to the control, with diode laser alone recording the highest mean microhardness. SEM analysis supported these findings by revealing improved surface morphology in treated samples.
population_specificity: In vitro enamel samples (not human subjects).
effective_dosage: MI varnish applied once for 7 days; diode laser irradiation details not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pre-acidification (PA) with different acids could improve the functional properties of low-moisture part-skim mozzarella made from high-casein milk by reducing insoluble calcium content.
results_summary: Pre-acidification with citric acid to pH 6.00 significantly reduced insoluble calcium levels, improved cheese functionality (e.g., lower hardness, better melt), and maintained proteolysis. Cheeses treated with citric acid PA showed better sensory performance on pizza compared to other treatments.
population_specificity: Not specified (study focused on cheese manufacturing, not human subjects).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study used pH adjustments: 6.40 and 6.00 with acetic, citric, or carbonic acid).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the remineralizing effect of CPP-ACP (casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate) and nHAp, with and without Er:YAG laser irradiation, on demineralized primary enamel.
results_summary: The study found that CPP-ACP increased surface microhardness, with greater improvement when combined with laser irradiation. However, nHAp showed comparable or better remineralization than CPP-ACP, especially with laser application.
population_specificity: Extracted primary incisors (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a targeted drug delivery system for daunorubicin using sodium caseinate nanoparticles modified with folic acid to reduce toxicity and improve specificity for cancer cells.
results_summary: The study found that sodium caseinate nanoparticles successfully encapsulated daunorubicin and were effectively targeted to cancer cells using folic acid. The synthesized nanoparticles had an average size of 8.117 nm and demonstrated potential as favorable carriers for targeted drug delivery.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or preclinical study implied by methodology).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential negative impact of casein-bound lactulosyllysine (LL) on liver health, specifically its role in inducing nonobese nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NONAFLD).
results_summary: The study found that casein-bound LL induced a NONAFLD phenotype in mice, characterized by reduced body weight gain, hypolipidemia, and intrahepatic lipid accumulation. Mechanistically, LL impaired lipid metabolism by inducing dicarbonyl stress and promoting carbonyl glycation in the liver.
population_specificity: Healthy C57BL/6 mice.
effective_dosage: Varying levels of casein-bound LL (specific amounts not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how transglutaminase (TGase)-crosslinked milk protein concentrate (MPC) and micellar casein concentrate (MCC) affect the functionality of imitation mozzarella cheese (IMC) compared to rennet casein (RCN).
results_summary: TGase-treated MPC and MCC increased viscosity and transition temperature while reducing meltability in IMC. These treated powders performed comparably to RCN in texture and some melted characteristics, though MPC-based IMC had lower transition temperatures and meltability than MCC-based IMC.
population_specificity: Dairy-based imitation mozzarella cheese formulations.
effective_dosage: TGase at 0.3 (L) and 3.0 (H) units/g of protein.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the adherence, palatability, usability, gastrointestinal tolerance, and metabolic control of a low tyrosine casein glycomacropeptide (cGMP) protein substitute in adults with NTBC-induced tyrosinaemia.
results_summary: The cGMP protein substitute showed high adherence (98%), positive palatability and usability ratings, preference over AA-based substitutes, no notable gastrointestinal changes, and maintained metabolic control.
population_specificity: Four adults (mean age 61.1 years) with alkaptonuria (AKU) and NTBC-induced tyrosinaemia recruited from the UK National Alkaptonuria Centre.
effective_dosage: 20 g protein equivalent, prescribed based on individual nutritional requirements.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate protein aggregation pathways (Maillard and DHA-derived) in lactose-hydrolyzed UHT milk (LHM) and conventional UHT milk, focusing on processing methods and lactase enzyme purity.
results_summary: Prehydrolyzed LHM showed higher Maillard-related markers, while conventional UHT milk had more DHA-derived cross-links. Intramicellar cross-links involving αS1- and αS2-caseins were detected in larger particles during storage.
population_specificity: Not specified (study focused on milk processing and storage).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (processing methods compared, not dosages).
study_duration: Up to one year (storage at 25°C or 35°C).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of cheese and casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate (CPP-ACP) on remineralizing erosive lesions in primary teeth enamel caused by exposure to amoxicillin and ibuprofen syrups.
results_summary: The study found that both cheese and CPP-ACP significantly increased enamel microhardness after erosion caused by amoxicillin and ibuprofen syrups, with no significant difference between the two treatments in the amoxicillin group. The ibuprofen group showed a statistically insignificant difference between the control and CPP-ACP subgroups.
population_specificity: Noncarious deciduous molars (primary teeth) from pediatric patients.
effective_dosage: 10 minutes of therapy (cheese, CPP-ACP, or artificial saliva) after each 1-minute immersion in syrups, three times per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Na-caseinate coated magnetic nanoparticles (MNP) as a theranostic system for cancer diagnostics, drug delivery, and magnetic hyperthermia.
results_summary: The study found that Na-caseinate coating marginally affected the magnetic behavior of MNP while improving salt stability and enabling high drug loading (up to ~75%). The coated MNP demonstrated effective drug delivery into cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma cells (SCL-1) and suitability for magnetic particle imaging (MPI) and hyperthermia.
population_specificity: In vitro study using cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma cells (SCL-1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether increased thermo-mechanical processing could offset texture deficits in pasta filata-style cheese caused by milk homogenization.
results_summary: Homogenization alone did not significantly alter the samples, but thermo-mechanical processing led to distinct fibrous structures in non-homogenized samples and increased muscle activity and jaw movements during mastication.
population_specificity: Not specified (study focused on cheese processing, not human demographics).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study involved cheese processing, not dosage).
study_duration: Not specified (study focused on processing methods, not time).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to profile the jejunal mucosal transcriptome of cattle in response to postruminal casein infusion and exogenous GLP-2 to understand its effects on growth, starch assimilation, and barrier function.
results_summary: Postruminal casein infusion downregulated 7 jejunal mucosal genes but did not significantly enrich KEGG pathways or gene ontologies. The study primarily highlighted the transcriptional mechanisms of exogenous GLP-2, with casein's effects being less pronounced.
population_specificity: Holstein steers (250 ± 23.1 kg body weight)
effective_dosage: 1.30 g casein/kg of body weight, administered via continuous abomasal infusion

study_goal: The researchers aimed to increase the enzyme specificity of ficin for small proteins by generating steric hindrances to reduce its activity against large proteins like casein and hemoglobin.
results_summary: The modified biocatalyst maintained activity against small synthetic substrates but reduced activity against casein by over 50% and nearly eliminated activity against hemoglobin, with greater effectiveness at 37°C than 55°C. The biocatalyst remained stable and reusable for five cycles without loss of activity.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism of β-Lg-induced casein micelle aggregation during UHT processing to understand protein interactions in UHT milk.
results_summary: The study found that β-Lg destabilized casein micelles, increased their size and zeta potential, and formed complexes through hydrogen bonds, disulfide bonds, and non-covalent interactions. Molecular dynamics simulations identified electrostatic and van der Waals forces as key drivers of these interactions.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on milk proteins)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the enhanced therapeutic potential of PIP@CM (Piperine encapsulated in Casein micelles) against Huntington's disease in a zebrafish model.
results_summary: PIP@CM showed improved release and antioxidant activity in vitro, and in vivo treatment significantly improved behavioral performance and reduced oxidative stress markers compared to pure PIP and untreated HD models.
population_specificity: Zebrafish model of Huntington's disease induced by 3-nitropropionic acid (3-NPA).
effective_dosage: PIP@CM (25 mg/kg, equivalent to 5 mg/kg PIP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether smoking during lactation decreases β-casein concentrations in breast milk and whether miR-210-5p expression is involved in this suppression.
results_summary: Maternal smoke exposure during lactation significantly decreased β-casein expression in mammary epithelia, along with reduced STAT5 and pSTAT5 levels, while increasing miR-210-5p expression. Nicotine treatment also reduced β-casein protein levels and increased miR-210-5p expression in human mammary epithelial cells.
population_specificity: Lactating CD1 mice and non-malignant human mammary epithelial MCF-12A cells.
effective_dosage: Cigarette smoke exposure (1.7 mg tar, 14 mg nicotine) for 1 hour twice/day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of casein supplementation, alone and combined with probiotics, on the aerobic capacity of male soccer players.
results_summary: The study found that casein supplementation, especially when combined with probiotics, improved Time-to-exhaustion (TTE) and Time-HHV, indicating enhanced aerobic capacity. However, casein alone did not show significant differences compared to placebo in most measured outcomes.
population_specificity: 44 male soccer players (Age: 22.81 ± 2.76 yr, Height: 177.90 ± 6.75 cm, Weight: 67.42 ± 8.44 kg).
effective_dosage: 20 grams of casein powder consumed 45 minutes before bed, three times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of bioactive peptides derived from casein on performance, nutrient digestibility, enzyme activity, and intestinal microbial populations in broiler chickens.
results_summary: Casein peptides at 1000 mg/kg improved weight gain in grower, finisher, and whole periods, enhanced intestinal morphology, reduced oxidative stress in meat, and improved enzyme activity while increasing beneficial Lactobacillus and decreasing Coliform populations.
population_specificity: 1-day-old male Ross 308 broiler chickens
effective_dosage: 200, 400, 600, 800, and 1000 mg of peptides per kg of diet
study_duration: Not specified (whole periods implied but exact duration not stated)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of casein kinase 1 (CK1), particularly the CK1α isoform, in prostate cancer (PCa) and its potential as a novel therapeutic target.
results_summary: The study suggests that CK1α may regulate androgen receptor (AR) activity via phosphorylation and is implicated in prostate tumorigenesis, highlighting its potential as a therapeutic target for PCa. The review also discusses CK1's broader role in signaling pathways deregulated in cancer.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer research (not human subjects, but a review of existing literature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-cancer potential of casein and its derivatives, focusing on their selective cytotoxicity against tumor cells and molecular mechanisms of action.
results_summary: Casein and its derivatives demonstrated antitumor and cytotoxic effects on various tumor types without harming normal cells, acting through multiple signaling pathways including STAT1, STAT3/HIF1-α, and TLR4/NF-кB. These mechanisms suggest casein could be an effective adjuvant in cancer therapy.
population_specificity: Cells from various tumor types (specific human or animal models not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of cold plasma technology on the phosphorylation degree, functional properties, oxidation, and structure of casein in sheep milk.
results_summary: Cold plasma treatment for 3-4 min increased phosphorylation and improved functional properties (water-holding capacity, solubility, foaming). Protein oxidation was minimized at 2-3 min, but prolonged treatment destabilized protein conformation.
population_specificity: Sheep milk casein
effective_dosage: Cold plasma treatment at 10 kHz 20 kV for 2-4 min

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cytocompatibility and anti-inflammatory effects of casein enzymatic hydrolysate (CEH)-laden GelMA fibrous scaffolds on dental pulp stem cells (DPSCs).
results_summary: CEH-laden GelMA scaffolds showed improved DPSC viability and adhesion, with 10% CEH reducing pro-inflammatory cytokines (IL-6, IL-1α, TNF-α). Mechanical properties varied by CEH concentration, with 20% and 30% CEH increasing elongation at break.
population_specificity: Dental pulp stem cells (DPSCs) in vitro.
study_duration: Not explicitly stated (follow-up included seven-day viability assessment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of casein kinase 1 alpha (CK1α) in regulating Merkel cell polyomavirus (MCPyV) large T antigen (LT) stability and viral replication.
results_summary: The study found that CK1α negatively regulates MCPyV LT stability and replication by modulating interactions with the SCF β-TrCP complex. Inhibition of CK1α increased LT expression and enhanced viral replication, suggesting CK1α's role in limiting MCPyV replication for persistent infection.
population_specificity: The study focused on MCPyV-positive Merkel cell carcinoma (MCC) and related cellular mechanisms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an oral delivery system using chemically synthesized casein micelles to improve the bioavailability and efficacy of artesunate for treating systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
results_summary: The study found that casein-based micelles enhanced the stability, absorption, and bioavailability of artesunate, effectively alleviating SLE-like symptoms in mice with low toxicity and strong gastrointestinal adhesion.
population_specificity: MRL/lpr mice (a model for SLE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether casein kinase 2 (CK2) inhibition could overcome therapy resistance in RB1-deficient high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma (HGSC) and triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) cells.
results_summary: The study found that CK2 inhibition in RB1-deficient cells led to p130 degradation, S phase accumulation, micronuclei formation, and enhanced cell death when combined with replication-perturbing therapeutics. It also prevented regrowth in patient-derived HGSC organoids treated with carboplatin or niraparib.
population_specificity: Patients with RB1-deficient HGSC (25%) or TNBC (40%).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the transepithelial transport and stability of lactononadecapeptide (LNDP), a casein-derived peptide, to understand its potential for enhancing cognitive function.
results_summary: LNDP showed high stability (over 90%) against gastrointestinal enzymes and could traverse intestinal epithelium, primarily via the PEPT1 transporter. Its transport was significantly inhibited by Gly-Pro and PEPT1 knockdown, indicating PEPT1's crucial role in LNDP absorption.
population_specificity: In vitro (Caco-2 cell monolayers, HEK293 cells)
study_duration: Short-term (15-60 min for stability, transport assays)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the stability and swelling properties of casein microparticles under different conditions, particularly focusing on the effects of heat treatment and disulfide bridge formation.
results_summary: The study found that casein microparticles remain stable in acidic media but swell and disintegrate under slightly alkaline conditions. Heat treatment stabilizes the microparticles via disulfide bridges and hydrophobic contacts, with temperatures >60°C required for denatured whey protein to initiate these reactions. Preventing disulfide bridge formation during heat treatment alters the swelling behavior.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the stress-relieving and sleep-enhancing effects of casein hydrolysate (CP) and milk casein in chronically stressed mice, and to explore the underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: CP was more effective than milk casein in reducing stress-induced insomnia and anxiety, likely due to increased GABA, 5-HT, GABAA, 5-HT1A receptors, and BDNF, and decreased IL-6 and NMDA receptors. CP also restored brain and colon dysfunction by modulating the HPA response and ERK/CREB-BDNF-TrκB pathway.
population_specificity: Chronically stressed mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of hemp seed protein (HSP) and its hydrolysate-derived bioactive peptide (HSP+) on blood pressure against casein in adults with mild hypertension.
results_summary: Casein was used as a control and showed no significant blood pressure-lowering effects compared to HSP and HSP+, which significantly reduced both systolic and diastolic blood pressure. Casein was associated with higher plasma ACE and renin activities and lower nitric oxide concentrations compared to HSP treatments.
population_specificity: 35 adults with mild hypertension (SBP 130-160 mmHg, DBP ≤110 mmHg).
study_duration: 6 weeks per treatment, with 2-week washout periods.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular and mesoscopic structures of shellac and micellar casein complexes formed after pH-cycle treatment and their potential applications.
results_summary: The study found that shellac and casein formed stable nanocomplexes (~80 nm diameter) through covalent and non-covalent interactions, preventing shellac precipitation at pH 7.0. These complexes may be useful for creating novel colloidal systems and delivering lipophilic bioactive compounds.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: 0.5% w/v shellac with varying shellac:casein mass ratios

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of casein-containing anticaries agents (CPP-ACPF, MI Paste Plus) combined with fluoride and sodium trimetaphosphate in remineralizing early caries lesions in vitro.
results_summary: The study found that treatment with 1100 ppm fluoride combined with a TMP gel (1100F + Gel TMP) significantly increased remineralization compared to other treatments, showing higher surface hardness recovery, lower lesion depth, and increased calcium and phosphorus concentrations in enamel. The 1100F + MI Paste Plus group showed lower remineralization than 1100F alone, while 1100F + Gel F performed similarly to 1100F alone.
population_specificity: Bovine enamel blocks with initial caries lesions (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: MI Paste Plus applied 2x/day for 3 minutes; TMP gel (5%) applied once for 1 minute; fluoride gels (4,500 ppm and 9,000 ppm) applied once for 1 minute.
study_duration: pH cycling duration not specified; MI Paste Plus applied for an unspecified period (implied short-term).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of a gluten-free, casein-free (GFCF) diet in improving symptoms of autism spectrum disorder (ASD) in children.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in CARS scores for children on the GFCF diet compared to the control group after 6 months and 1 year, suggesting potential benefits for ASD symptoms. However, conclusive evidence remains controversial.
population_specificity: Newly diagnosed Egyptian children with ASD who had not received prior psychiatric or rehabilitation therapy.

study_goal: The study does not investigate Casein; it focuses on atovaquone's effects on gastric cancer.
results_summary: The study does not report any findings related to Casein.
population_specificity: Gastric cancer cell lines and mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential allergenicity of enzymatically hydrolyzed casein (HC) and its ability to alleviate allergic responses in a mouse model.
results_summary: Enzymatic hydrolysis (Alcalase and Protamex) significantly reduced casein's allergenicity (68.25% and 50.75%, respectively). HC alleviated allergic symptoms in mice, reduced Th2-associated cytokines, increased IFN-γ, and improved inflammation in the lung, jejunum, and ileum.
population_specificity: Balb/c mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether camel milk casein nanoparticles could enhance the effectiveness of sorafenib as a delivery system against hepatocellular carcinoma cells.
results_summary: Sorafenib-loaded casein nanoparticles showed improved stability, high encapsulation efficiency, and significantly increased apoptosis in HepG2 cells compared to free sorafenib, with enhanced ROS production and regulation of apoptotic genes.
population_specificity: Human hepatocarcinoma cells (HepG2 cells) in vitro.
study_duration: Nanoparticles were stable for 1 month; treatment duration not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop lutein-loaded casein-saccharide conjugates via the Maillard reaction to enhance lutein delivery and protect retinal pigment epithelial cells against oxidative damage.
results_summary: The study found that lutein-loaded casein-saccharide nanoparticles improved thermal stability, antioxidant capacity, and cellular protection against oxidative damage, with no observed toxicity.
population_specificity: Adult retinal pigment epithelial (ARPE-19) cells in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how dielectric barrier discharge (DBD) plasma treatment affects the allergenicity of casein during in vitro simulated digestion, focusing on IgE-binding capacity and immune responses.
results_summary: DBD plasma treatment (4 min) reduced IgE-binding capacity by 10.5% and decreased release of biologically active substances (e.g., histamine, IL-4, IL-6, TNF-α) from sensitized cells. The treatment also promoted degradation of IgE linear epitopes, particularly in α-helix regions of αs1-CN and αs2-CN.
population_specificity: In vitro simulated digestion and sensitized-cell model (KU812 cells).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how glucose affects hexokinase activity in bovine mammary epithelial cells (BMEC) and investigate its regulatory role in kappa casein (CSN3) synthesis via the mTORC1 signaling pathway.
results_summary: The study found that glucose uptake, cell proliferation, and CSN3 expression increased with higher glucose concentrations, while knockout of HK1 and HK2 inhibited these effects, suggesting their role in CSN3 synthesis via glycolysis and S6K1 activation.
population_specificity: Bovine mammary epithelial cells (BMEC)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a novel microcapsule using casein and gum Arabic to encapsulate Lactiplantibacillus plantarum A3, improving its survival during gastrointestinal digestion, storage, and lyophilization.
results_summary: The casein and gum Arabic microcapsules significantly improved the survival of L. plantarum A3 in gastrointestinal fluid and lyophilization, and enhanced its ability to regulate intestinal microbiota by altering bacterial abundances.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vivo study, but exact population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Casein nanoparticles (Cn NPs) with glutathione (GSH) could effectively target and treat triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) by delivering therapeutic payloads directly to cancer cells.
results_summary: The study found that Casein Nano-Trojan (CCNG NPs) effectively delivered Camptothecin and IR 797 to TNBC cells, inducing high cell death (85 ± 7%), mitochondrial membrane disintegration, and inhibition of migration and re-growth. Significant therapeutic efficacy was observed in 3D spheroids and in vivo mouse models.
population_specificity: Triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) cells (4T1) and BALB/c mice with breast cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of casein as a low-cost, bio-based adsorbent for removing organic pollutants (anionic dyes and pharmaceutical waste) from industrial wastewater.
results_summary: Casein demonstrated strong adsorption performance for pollutants, with maximum capacities of 85.54 mg g⁻¹ (Congo red), 31.72 mg g⁻¹ (Eriochrome Black T), 70.42 mg g⁻¹ (Eosin Y), and 358.42 mg g⁻¹ (diclofenac sodium), achieving 91.43% removal efficiency for a fabric whitener. Interactions were attributed to electrostatic, hydrogen bonding, hydrophobic, and π-π mechanisms.
population_specificity: Industrial wastewater pollutants (anionic dyes and pharmaceutical waste).
effective_dosage: Not specified (adsorption capacity measured in mg g⁻¹).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining photobiomodulation therapy (PBMT) with casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate fluoride (CPP-ACPF) paste could reduce post-home whitening tooth sensitivity without affecting shade change.
results_summary: The study found that CPP-ACPF paste, both alone and combined with PBMT, significantly reduced tooth sensitivity compared to placebo, without compromising whitening efficacy. The CPP-ACPF and PBMT groups showed similar reductions in sensitivity, while the placebo group exhibited higher sensitivity.
population_specificity: 50 participants undergoing home whitening treatment with 22% carbamide peroxide.
effective_dosage: Not specified (paste application frequency not detailed).
study_duration: 21 days of whitening treatment, with follow-up at 30 days post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a casein-based dressing that detects proteolytic activity in chronic wounds and potentially aids in healing by serving as a scaffold for cell adhesion and growth.
results_summary: Casein-based films showed controlled mechanical characteristics, water absorption, and proteolytic stability based on heat treatment duration. The films responded to bacterial and nonbacterial proteases, reduced proteolytic activity by 36%, and released non-cytotoxic fragments that scavenged 90% of radicals.
population_specificity: Diabetic patients with chronic wounds (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (films tested with protease levels of 10 and 200 ng mL-1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate (CPP-ACP) could protect nickel-titanium archwires from corrosion and reduce nickel release during orthodontic treatment.
results_summary: Wires exposed to CPP-ACP showed smoother surfaces and lower nickel content compared to those exposed to routine oral hygiene, suggesting protective effects against corrosion. The differences were statistically significant (P < 0.001).
population_specificity: 40 orthodontic patients with fixed appliances.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate chewing gum against chlorhexidine mouthwash and other interventions on reducing salivary Streptococcus mutans counts.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in S. mutans counts for the casein group compared to baseline (P = 0.340), suggesting it was less effective than xylitol gum or CHX mouthwash.
population_specificity: 120 dental students

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how electron beam irradiation (EBI) at varying doses affects the structural and functional properties of casein.
results_summary: EBI treatment caused structural changes in casein, including fragmentation, aggregation, and exposure of hydrophobic groups, which initially improved functional properties (solubility, emulsification, foaming, rheology) before declining at higher doses. Optimal functional properties were observed at 4-6 kGy irradiation.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on casein protein).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the remineralization efficacy of casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate topical cream against strontium-doped nano-hydroxyapatite paste and regular dentifrice for treating white spot lesions on enamel.
results_summary: The casein-based cream (Group 3) showed effective remineralization potential compared to the control (Group 1), but was outperformed by strontium-doped nano-hydroxyapatite paste (Group 2).
population_specificity: 90 individuals with white spot lesions on enamel following orthodontic debonding.
effective_dosage: Specified amount applied twice daily (exact dosage not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether casein-dextran glycated conjugates (UGCA) and carboxymethyl cellulose (CMC) could improve the stability and controlled release of anthocyanins (ACNs).
results_summary: The study found that ACNs-loaded ternary complexes (ACNs-UGCA-CMC) showed better encapsulation efficiency, colloidal stability, and protective effects against degradation compared to binary complexes (ACNs-UGCA). The ternary complexes also demonstrated slower release in vitro and longer retention in vivo.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (ultrasonic treatment at 40% amplitude for 8 minutes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the biosafety and bioavailability of casein manganese oxide nanoparticles (CMnNP) for therapeutic angiogenesis in wound treatment and hindlimb ischemia recovery.
results_summary: The study found CMnNP to be non-toxic, with negligible changes in hematological, biochemical, and histopathological parameters, even at high doses. It also demonstrated normal clearance and no adverse cytokine responses, supporting its potential as a therapeutic angiogenic agent.
population_specificity: C57BL/6J mice
study_duration: Acute (2 weeks), sub-chronic (4 weeks), chronic (8 and 20 weeks)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of caseinomacropeptide (CMP) content and heat treatment on the physicochemical stability of protein systems in infant nutritional formulations.
results_summary: The study found that sweet whey (SW) with CMP, when preheated with skim milk, improved heat stability compared to acid whey (AW). Calcium addition reduced heat stability, but preheated systems were less affected.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on protein systems)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current strategies for targeting Casein Kinase 1 (CK1) in cancer therapy and discuss future perspectives in this field.
results_summary: The study highlights various approaches, including small molecule inhibitors, RNA interference, genome editing, and immunotherapies, as potential methods to modulate CK1 activity in cancer cells. It also discusses challenges in targeting CK1 and proposes strategies to overcome them, emphasizing its promise as a therapeutic strategy for cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of CK1 in cancer therapy)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of casein kinase 2 (CK2) in modulating SK channel activity and dopamine neuron function in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The study found that CK2 up-regulation in dopamine neurons contributed to SK channel dysfunction and neuronal hyperexcitability in 3xTg-AD mice. Pharmacological inhibition of CK2 restored normal SK channel activity and firing patterns.
population_specificity: 3xTg-AD mice (a transgenic mouse model of Alzheimer's disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of high-quality protein supplementation, including casein, on cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk factors.
results_summary: Casein supplementation was found to decrease systolic blood pressure (SBP) by -4.10 mmHg, though the confidence interval was wide (-8.05, -0.14). The study did not report other significant effects of casein on CVD risk factors compared to other high-quality proteins.
population_specificity: Individuals with varying health statuses, including hypertensive and overweight/obese individuals.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the potential use of casein glycomacropeptide (GMP) as a treatment for phenylketonuria (PKU).
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Casein's effects, only mentioning it as one of the approaches considered for PKU treatment.
population_specificity: Individuals with phenylketonuria (PKU).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of casein, as part of milk proteins, in improving muscle mass and strength compared to other protein types and timing strategies.
results_summary: Casein, along with other milk proteins, was found to be effective for gains in both muscle mass and strength, with moderate certainty. No significant enhancement in physical performance was observed.
population_specificity: 4,711 participants across 116 randomized controlled trials, likely including adults engaged in resistance training.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of a new oral iron formulation conjugated with N-aspartyl-casein (Fe-ASP) versus ferrous sulfate in treating iron-deficiency anemia.
results_summary: The study compared Fe-ASP with ferrous sulfate over 12 weeks but did not report specific outcomes regarding Casein's effects in the abstract.
population_specificity: 60 patients with iron-deficiency anemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of essential amino acids (EAAs) versus whey protein on plasma protein expression and physical function in older adults with low physical function.
results_summary: The study found that five proteins, including casein kinase II 2-alpha, showed significantly higher fold change expression in the EAA group, potentially contributing to improved muscle strength and physical function. Fifteen other proteins showed slightly lower fold change expression in the EAA group, some of which were associated with inflammation or comorbidities.
population_specificity: Older adults with low physical function.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of milk protein (MP) supplementation on glycemic parameters in adults through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: MP supplementation significantly reduced fasting blood glucose, fasting insulin, and HOMA-IR levels but did not notably affect HbA1c, except in participants with normal baseline BMI. The effects varied by dosage, duration, and protein type (whey protein showed specific benefits).
population_specificity: Adults (1851 participants across 36 RCTs)
effective_dosage: High (≥60 g/d), moderate (30-60 g/d), and low (<30 g/d) doses of whey protein (WP) were used.
study_duration: Short-term (≤8 weeks) and long-term (>8 weeks) interventions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of nutritional interventions, including casein-free diets, on behavioral symptoms in children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
results_summary: The study found that casein-free diets showed positive results in most analyzed articles, but the evidence was heterogeneous, requiring further research to confirm effectiveness.
population_specificity: Children under 19 years of age with ASD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of casein hydrolysate supplementation on blood pressure, blood lipids, and blood glucose through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Casein hydrolysate significantly reduced systolic and diastolic blood pressure but had no effect on blood lipids or fasting blood glucose compared to placebo diets.
population_specificity: Not specified (participants from eligible randomized controlled trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pre-sleep casein supplementation provided benefits for endurance athletes beyond increased total protein intake, specifically assessing its effects on fatigue, recovery, and performance.
results_summary: The study found no beneficial effects of casein supplementation, whether taken before sleep or earlier in the day, on fatigue, recovery, or performance in professional cyclists during a short-term training camp.
population_specificity: Professional U23 cyclists (19 ± 1 years, peak oxygen uptake: 79.8 ± 4.9 ml/kg/min).
effective_dosage: 40 g of casein, administered once daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of fish protein diets versus casein on serum/plasma total cholesterol (TC) concentration in rodents.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that fish protein consumption significantly lowered circulating TC concentration compared to casein, with a mean difference of -0.24 mmol/l. However, the risk of bias was unclear due to insufficient reporting in the SYRCLE's tool.
population_specificity: Rodents (935 subjects across 39 studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of casein glycomacropeptide (GMP) as a treatment for PKU, focusing on its ability to improve immunological function and manage blood phenylalanine concentrations.
results_summary: The study suggests that casein GMP, which contains limited aromatic amino acids, may improve immunological function and help maintain blood phenylalanine levels within the target range (120-360 μmol/L) in PKU patients. It is presented as part of a dietary treatment strategy alongside other interventions like LNAA supplementation and enzyme therapies.
population_specificity: Individuals with phenylketonuria (PKU), including severe (classic PKU) and less severe forms (moderate PKU, mild PKU, mild hyperphenylalaninaemia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether RLX2™, containing alpha-s1-casein tryptic hydrolysate and L-theanine, improves sleep quality in working adults with poor sleep.
results_summary: RLX2™ significantly improved multiple sleep metrics, including PSQI total score, sleep latency, duration, habitual efficiency, and daytime dysfunction, while increasing alpha power. The supplement also prolonged total sleep time by 45 minutes compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Working adults affected by poor sleep quality (n=39).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the short-term effect of casein supplementation on health-related quality of life (HRQoL) and nutritional/functional status in patients awaiting liver transplantation.
results_summary: Casein supplementation improved HRQoL similarly to whey protein, with no significant differences between groups. However, it did not improve nutritional or functional status. Patients meeting protein requirements and having a positive energy balance showed higher HRQoL scores.
population_specificity: Patients awaiting liver transplantation, with 56.9% presenting malnutrition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether casein glycomacropeptide (CGMP) could reduce plasma levels of dopamine precursors (phenylalanine and tyrosine) as a potential intervention for acute manic episodes.
results_summary: CGMP administration led to a dose-dependent depletion of plasma aromatic amino acids, with the highest depletion observed at 60 g. The effect peaked after 3-4 hours, and no significant side effects were reported.
population_specificity: 15 healthy men
effective_dosage: 20 g, 40 g, and 60 g of CGMP (with added leucine and tryptophan), administered with at least 14-day intervals
study_duration: Single administration per dose, with follow-up measurements

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether bovine colostrum (BC), which contains casein, is a safe and effective nutritional supplement for improving gut function and health in infants and children, particularly in cases of immune and gut immaturity or disorders.
results_summary: The study suggests that BC, including casein, may improve health outcomes in infants and children, particularly for immune and gut-related conditions, when supplemented at optimal levels and ages. Adverse effects like allergies or intolerance appear unlikely when BC is used as a supplement within normal nutritional guidelines.
population_specificity: Infants, children, and pediatric subpopulations (including preterm births, infections, and gut disorders).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of pre-sleep casein protein supplementation on energy expenditure, lipolysis, appetite, and food intake in healthy and overweight or obese individuals.
results_summary: The study found limited to no effects on metabolism or appetite when ingesting 24-48 g of casein 30 min before sleep, though data were limited and further research is needed.
population_specificity: Healthy individuals and overweight or obese individuals.
effective_dosage: 24-48 g of casein 30 min before sleep.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of soy protein supplementation versus casein placebo on PSA levels in men with biochemical recurrence after prostatectomy.
results_summary: The study found that casein placebo did not significantly affect PSA levels compared to soy protein, with both groups showing similar increases in PSA and no difference in PSA doubling times. Two subjects in the casein group had stable PSA levels.
population_specificity: Men who recurred (PSA > 0.1 ng/ml) within three years of prostatectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of additional protein intake, including casein, on lean body mass preservation in post-bariatric patients.
results_summary: The study found inconclusive evidence for lean body mass preservation due to protein supplementation, including casein, with only two of five studies showing significant effects. No significant differences were observed in body fat mass, total body water, or body mass index between high-protein and control groups.
population_specificity: Post-bariatric surgery patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of soy protein isolate supplementation against a casein-based placebo on steroid hormones and cancer biomarkers in males at risk of prostate cancer recurrence.
results_summary: Casein was used as a placebo and showed no significant effects on testosterone, SHBG, estradiol, or other cancer biomarkers compared to soy protein isolate, which reduced circulating testosterone and SHBG. The study did not report adverse effects from casein consumption.
population_specificity: Middle-aged to older males at risk of prostate cancer recurrence after radical prostatectomy.
effective_dosage: Not specified for casein (used as placebo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the evidence on the effects of cow-milk protein supplementation (CPS) on health outcomes in the elderly.
results_summary: CPS showed beneficial effects in preserving or improving muscle mass in healthy and pre-frail/frail/sarcopenic elderly individuals, with weaker evidence for positive effects on bones, cardiovascular disease, inflamm-aging, and other areas. It was also noted as an important contributor to nutritional needs.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals, including healthy subjects and pre-frail, frail, or sarcopenic patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the digestive peptidome of bovine and caprine milk serum proteins under infant-simulating conditions to assess differences in peptide release during digestion.
results_summary: The study found that while the degradation patterns of milk proteins were similar between bovine and caprine milk, the digestive rates differed. Caprine milk serum released more peptides from certain proteins (e.g., LALBA, LGB, SAA1, GLYCAM1, LTF) compared to bovine milk serum, but more peptides derived from α-casein were released from bovine milk.
population_specificity: In vitro infant-simulating conditions (not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of home-based resistance exercise and multi-ingredient supplementation (including Casein) on muscle mass, strength, and function in older men.
results_summary: The study found that twelve weeks of home-based resistance band training combined with daily multi-ingredient supplementation improved muscle-related outcomes in sedentary older men, though specific results for Casein were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Sedentary older men.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of casein-free diets on autism symptoms, particularly gastrointestinal and behavioral issues.
results_summary: The study suggests that casein-free diets, along with other dietary interventions, show promising results in improving gut health and reducing autism symptoms, though the neurological and behavioral impacts remain uncertain.
population_specificity: Autistic children with reported gastrointestinal problems.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of casein protein on lipid profiles, biomarkers of bone metabolism, and inflammation compared to soy protein.
results_summary: Casein significantly reduced bone alkaline phosphatase and body fat %, tended to decrease tartrate-resistant acid phosphatase, and significantly increased serum IGF-1, though less than soy. It had no effect on cholesterol levels or C-reactive protein.
population_specificity: 90 men and women aged 27-87.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether mixed power training (MPT) combined with fast-digested protein (F-PROT) or slow-digested protein (S-PROT, casein) provided greater improvements in muscle function and quality in elderly men compared to MPT alone.
results_summary: The study found that adding 30 g/day of casein (S-PROT) to MPT did not provide additional benefits over MPT alone in improving muscle function, quality, or other measured parameters in elderly men. All groups showed similar improvements in muscle characteristics and serum markers, with no significant differences between casein, whey, or placebo groups.
population_specificity: Elderly men (age 69 ± 7 years, BMI 18-30 kg/m²)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether protein supplementation (specifically casein) enhances whole-body oxidative capacity and endurance exercise performance during chronic endurance training.
results_summary: The study found that casein supplementation did not significantly improve V˙O2max, endurance performance, or muscular endurance compared to a carbohydrate placebo, though it showed a slight tendency to increase leg lean mass.
population_specificity: 60 recreationally active, healthy young males (age 27 ± 6 years).
effective_dosage: 28.7 g casein protein after each exercise session and before sleep.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of presleep versus daytime casein protein supplementation on subcutaneous abdominal adipose tissue lipolysis and whole-body substrate utilization in resistance-trained women.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in overnight lipolysis or fat oxidation between daytime and presleep casein consumption, indicating that presleep casein does not negatively impact fat metabolism.
population_specificity: Young, resistance-trained women (mean age 22 ± 1 y, BMI 24.3 ± 0.8 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: 30 g casein, consumed either post-exercise (daytime) or presleep.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential role of milk proteins, including casein, in the prevention and management of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) by summarizing existing evidence.
results_summary: The study found that milk proteins, including casein, increase postprandial insulin response and lower postprandial blood glucose levels in both healthy individuals and T2DM patients, likely due to bioactive peptides and amino acids influencing gastric emptying and incretin responses.
population_specificity: Healthy subjects and patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether low-dose supplementation with milk proteins (casein-whey mixture) could improve glucose regulation and lipid concentrations in overweight healthy adults.
results_summary: Casein supplementation significantly reduced postprandial glucose concentrations (-7%) and insulin c-peptide levels (-23%), along with notable reductions in serum concentrations of α-hydroxybutyrate (-23%), acetoacetate (-39%), and β-hydroxybutyrate (-40%). These effects were more pronounced compared to some fish protein groups.
population_specificity: Overweight healthy adults (n=77 analyzed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the anabolic potency and efficacy of a novel whey protein hydrolysate mixture (WPH) versus intact whey protein (WHEY) on mTORC1 signaling and muscle protein synthesis in young men.
results_summary: Both WPH and WHEY similarly increased leucine transport, mTORC1 activation, and muscle protein synthesis (~43%). Phenylalanine utilization remained elevated longer with WPH.
population_specificity: Healthy young men (aged 28.7 ± 3.6 y, BMI 25.2 ± 2.9 kg/m²).
study_duration: Acute effects measured over 3 hours post-ingestion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of soluble keratin (KER) and casein protein (CAS) on body composition, blood and cardiorespiratory variables, and cycling performance in endurance-trained males.
results_summary: Casein showed no significant changes in body mass, percentage body fat, or lean mass compared to baseline. It was less effective than KER in increasing bone-free lean mass, particularly in the legs. No significant effects on blood parameters, oxygen consumption, or exercise performance were observed.
population_specificity: 15 endurance-trained males

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the aminoacidemic, glycemic, and insulinemic responses following ingestion of micellar casein versus whey protein and a blend of both in young adult men.
results_summary: The study found that the protein blend's essential amino acid response was similar to whey and greater than casein alone. Casein showed a lower peak plasma essential amino acid concentration compared to the blend and whey.
population_specificity: Young adult men
study_duration: Blood samples were drawn over 6 hours post-ingestion

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of pre-sleep consumption of cottage cheese (whole-food protein) versus casein protein and placebo on next-morning resting energy expenditure (REE), RER, and appetite in active women.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in acute or morning REE, RER, or subjective appetite between cottage cheese, casein protein, and placebo groups, suggesting similar metabolic responses.
population_specificity: Ten active women (age 23.1 ± 1.9 years, body fat 22.0 ± 4.6%).
effective_dosage: 30 g of protein (casein or cottage cheese) consumed once before sleep.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of soy protein and animal proteins (including casein) on strength and lean body mass gains during resistance exercise training.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found no significant difference in strength gains between whey and soy protein supplementation, but casein's specific effects were not highlighted. Acute studies suggested whey protein stimulates muscle protein synthesis more than casein, but long-term effects were unclear.
population_specificity: 266 participants engaged in resistance exercise training.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and effects of purified rice endosperm protein (REP) against soy and casein proteins in MHD patients, focusing on protein intake and metabolic outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that REP supplementation increased protein intake (nPCR) without significantly altering serum phosphorus or potassium levels compared to placebo. No significant effects on other nutritional or metabolic parameters or complications were observed.
population_specificity: 50 Japanese adult maintenance hemodialysis (MHD) patients (1 dropped out).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of protein intake, including casein, in muscle protein synthesis and body composition for exercising individuals.
results_summary: Pre-sleep casein protein intake (30-40 g) increases overnight muscle protein synthesis and metabolic rate without affecting lipolysis. Casein, as a high-quality protein, is effective when consumed in adequate doses with essential amino acids and leucine.
population_specificity: Healthy, exercising individuals, particularly resistance-trained and endurance athletes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of pre-sleep protein ingestion, specifically Casein, on overnight muscle protein synthesis and its role in enhancing muscle mass and strength during resistance training.
results_summary: The study found that pre-sleep protein ingestion effectively stimulates muscle protein synthesis overnight, with at least 40 g of protein required for robust effects. Combining pre-sleep protein with prior exercise further enhances its utilization for muscle protein synthesis.
population_specificity: Individuals engaged in resistance-type exercise training.
effective_dosage: At least 40 g of protein prior to sleep.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of varying ratios of milk soluble proteins (fast-digested) and casein (slow-digested) on muscle adaptations during a 9-week resistance training program.
results_summary: The study found that higher leucine bioavailability occurred with fast-digested protein (FP(100) and FP(50)) compared to casein-dominant (FP(20)), but all groups showed similar improvements in lean body mass and muscle strength after resistance training.
population_specificity: 31 resistance-trained men
effective_dosage: 20g of protein per dose, with varying ratios (100% fast, 50% fast/50% casein, 20% fast/80% casein)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether casein glycomacropeptide (CGMP) could improve disease activity in patients with active ulcerative colitis (UC) when added to standard treatment.
results_summary: CGMP showed similar disease-modifying effects to mesalamine dose escalation, with 63% of CGMP-treated patients showing unchanged or decreased disease activity. The supplement was well tolerated and accepted by patients.
population_specificity: 24 patients with active UC involving 10-40 cm of the distal colon.
study_duration: 4 weeks (with adherence documented up to 8 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of cysteine-rich whey protein (Immunocal®) versus casein supplementation, combined with resistance training, on muscle strength and lean body mass in elderly individuals.
results_summary: The study found that both casein and Immunocal® groups showed significant increases in muscle strength (31.0% and 39.3%, respectively), with Immunocal® demonstrating approximately 10% greater improvement. No significant changes in lean body mass were observed in either group.
population_specificity: Non-frail elderly subjects (99 recruited, 84 completed, 67 compliant).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a soy-dairy protein blend (containing 50% casein) versus whey protein isolate on hyperaminoacidemia, mTORC1 signaling, and muscle protein anabolism in older adults after resistance exercise.
results_summary: Both the protein blend (PB) and whey protein isolate (WPI) increased amino acid concentrations and mTORC1 signaling, but WPI showed a more pronounced increase in fractional synthesis rate (FSR) and decrease in fractional breakdown rate (FBR). PB did not significantly increase FSR but made net protein balance less negative, similar to WPI.
population_specificity: Men aged 55-75 years.
effective_dosage: 30 g protein (PB: 25% soy, 25% whey, 50% casein; WPI: 100% whey) consumed once post-exercise.
study_duration: Single-dose intervention post-exercise (duration not specified beyond acute measurements).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether extensively hydrolyzed casein formula (EHCF) supplemented with Lactobacillus rhamnosus GG (LGG) promotes tolerance acquisition in infants with cow's milk allergy (CMA) by influencing gut microbiota.
results_summary: The study found that EHCF+LGG treatment enriched specific gut bacteria (Blautia, Roseburia, Coprococcus) and increased fecal butyrate levels in tolerant infants, suggesting a role in promoting tolerance. Oscillospira was the only genus significantly different between tolerant and allergic infants.
population_specificity: Infants with cow's milk allergy (n=19) and healthy controls (n=20).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of leucine-enriched whey protein and casein protein supplements on serum amino acid profiles and gastrointestinal behavior in older adults.
results_summary: Casein supplements resulted in lower peak serum leucine, EAA, and TAA concentrations compared to whey protein, particularly in low-caloric formulations. In vitro, casein showed gastric coagulation and slower intestinal protein digestion than whey.
population_specificity: Twelve healthy older subjects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical tolerance and nutritional efficacy of an extensively hydrolysed casein-based formula (eHCF) with probiotic supplementation in infants with cows' milk protein allergy (CMPA).
results_summary: The study found that the eHCF was well-tolerated, significantly improved the SCORAD index for atopic dermatitis, and enhanced growth indices (weight-for-age, length-for-age, and weight-for-length z scores). Probiotic supplementation did not impact these outcomes.
population_specificity: Infants with cows' milk protein allergy (CMPA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the optimal type of protein (including casein) for human milk fortification in preterm infants by evaluating whey-to-casein ratio, hydrolyzed vs. intact protein, and bovine vs. human milk protein.
results_summary: No definite advantage was found for any specific whey-to-casein ratio. Casein-containing products supported adequate growth and biochemical indicators of nutrition status, with plasma amino acid levels similar to those of infants fed human milk-based diets.
population_specificity: Preterm or low-birth-weight infants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential role of casein-free diets in improving symptoms of autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
results_summary: The study found that casein-free diets, along with other dietary interventions, showed contradictory but promising results in reducing ASD symptoms, particularly gastrointestinal issues, though their neurological impact remains uncertain.
population_specificity: Children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of lactotripeptides (LTP) derived from casein in reducing blood pressure through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a statistically significant but modest reduction in systolic (-2.95 mmHg) and diastolic (-1.51 mmHg) blood pressure with LTP supplementation, with greater effects observed in Japanese populations. However, 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure responses were non-significant, and publication biases were identified.
population_specificity: Adults, with sub-group analyses highlighting Japanese individuals as showing greater effects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of casein, whey protein, and soy isolates on muscle protein synthesis in the context of sarcopenia prevention.
results_summary: The study found that whey protein increased muscle protein synthesis more than casein or soy isolates, and essential amino acids were more effective than nonessential amino acids in stimulating muscle protein synthesis.
population_specificity: Older adults at risk of sarcopenia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of casein supplementation on health-related quality of life (HRQL) in patients with hepatitis C virus (HCV) and compare it to soy supplementation.
results_summary: Casein supplementation significantly improved HRQL scores in HCV patients after 12 weeks, with no significant difference observed compared to soy supplementation. HRQL improvements were correlated with baseline factors like age, serum albumin levels, lean mass, and body fat percentage.
population_specificity: Patients infected with hepatitis C virus (HCV) (n=68 in the Casein Group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of casein supplementation combined with exercise training on blood pressure, arterial function, and muscle strength in obese women.
results_summary: Casein supplementation significantly reduced brachial and aortic systolic blood pressure, wave reflection (AIx@75), and arterial stiffness (baPWV) compared to the control group, with no significant differences in muscle strength improvements across groups. The improvements in arterial function were not correlated with muscle strength gains.
population_specificity: Thirty-three obese, sedentary women (average age 30 years, BMI 35.2 kg/m²) with prehypertension or hypertension.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how different linseed varieties (Opal and Szafir) influenced the concentration of milk constituents, particularly fatty acids and casein content, in cow's milk.
results_summary: The Szafir linseed variety significantly increased casein content (39.9% higher) compared to Opal, along with improvements in milk fat (19.7% higher) and protein (2.9% higher). The study concluded that linseed variety affects milk composition, with Szafir offering superior nutritional benefits.
population_specificity: 30 Polish Holstein Friesian cows

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the acute effects of casein and other dietary proteins on postprandial lipemia in obese non-diabetic subjects.
results_summary: The study found that casein supplementation did not significantly lower postprandial lipemia compared to whey protein, which showed a more pronounced effect. Casein's impact was similar to cod protein and gluten in this context.
population_specificity: Obese non-diabetic subjects (age 40-68, BMI 30.3-42.0 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of maternal allergy and probiotic intervention on BM food antibodies, including casein, and their influence on allergy development in children.
results_summary: Maternal allergy was associated with higher levels of IgA to casein in mature breast milk, while probiotic supplementation reduced casein IgA antibodies. Casein antibodies were detectable in most samples but did not show a strong direct link to allergy prevention.
population_specificity: Mothers with an increased risk for allergy and their children, followed until ages 2 and 5.
study_duration: Probiotic intervention duration not specified; follow-up until children were 5 years old.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the predictors of the antihypertensive effect of IPP-VPP lactotripeptides (LTPs) derived from casein in untreated subjects at risk for cardiovascular disease.
results_summary: Short-term supplementation with LTPs significantly reduced office systolic and diastolic blood pressure, particularly in male subjects, with no significant changes in ambulatory blood pressure measurements. The main predictor of the antihypertensive effect was baseline blood pressure.
population_specificity: 164 pharmacologically untreated subjects in primary prevention for cardiovascular disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of S-carboxyethylcysteine (CEC) on protein use in casein diets and identify the first limiting amino acid in Acacia colei.
